channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: UK’s Cameron says support for Israel ‘not unconditional’
item.description: Foreign secretary says the UK expects Israel to 'abide by international humanitarian law' as war enters seventh month.

item.title: Israel ‘pulls out troops’ from southern Gaza as attacks enter seventh month
item.description: Israeli army says it is withdrawing most troops from Khan Younis, though a ‘significant force’ will continue to operate.

item.title: Anti-gov’t protesters hit by car in Israel
item.description: Video shows a car ramming a crowd of anti-government protesters in Israel during mass demonstrations against Netanyahu.

item.title: Mexico cuts ties with Ecuador after police raid embassy
item.description: Ecuador’s police nabbed their former vice president in Mexico’s embassy by force, causing Mexico to cut diplomatic ties.

item.title: How credible is US rhetoric on ‘policy change’ towards Israel?
item.description: Annelle Sheline talks about quitting her job at the US State Department due to frustration over 'naive' Israel policy.

item.title: In Ecuador, gov’t sees mining as the future. But communities are divided
item.description: Ecuador sees mining as a 'crucial driver' of the economy, providing jobs and incomes, but locals disagree.

item.title: The judicial legacy of the Rwandan genocide: 30 years of double standards
item.description: The international community’s efforts to prosecute perpetrators of core crimes remain selective and politicised.

item.title: Federal emergency declared in Russia’s flood-hit Orenburg region
item.description: The floods, caused by rising water levels in the Ural river, force thousands of people to evacuate.

item.title: Israel may have started a forever war in Gaza
item.description: As Israel continues the war in Gaza, with no indication of a victory, it risks formenting endless conflict.

item.title: Israel’s message: ‘Don’t feed the Palestinians’
item.description: The killing of the seven aid workers in Gaza is a direct consequence of Israel’s brutal ‘rules of engagement’.

item.title: Israel’s war on Gaza: List of key events, day 184
item.description: Indirect talks set in Egypt with CIA director, Qatari PM holding separate meetings with Israeli and Hamas delegations.

item.title: Six months of Israel’s relentless war on Gaza
item.description: Six months have passed since Israel began its brutal war on Gaza, killing more than 33,000 Palestinians.

item.title: Djokovic wants last dance with Nadal at French Open tennis
item.description: World number one Novak Djokovic is hoping for one last matchup with the 14-time French Open champion at Roland Garros.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 773
item.description: As the war enters its 773rd day, these are the main developments.

item.title: China holds ‘combat patrol’ in South China Sea amid US-led war games
item.description: Beijing's naval and air patrols in the disputed waterway take place as several US allies conduct first joint drills.

item.title: When is Eid al-Fitr 2024 and how is it celebrated?
item.description: The three-day festival celebrates the completion of the fasting month of Ramadan by Muslims across the world.

item.title: Max Verstappen bounces back with dominant F1 win at Japanese Grand Prix
item.description: Red Bull return to winning form, with Max Verstappen leading teammate Sergio Perez to a one-two finish at Suzuka.

item.title: Peter Pellegrini elected Slovakia president in boost for pro-Russia PM Fico
item.description: Parliament Speaker Peter Pellegrini wins second round of presidential election, cementing grip of the pro-Russian PM.

item.title: Rwanda genocide: ‘Frozen faces still haunt’ photojournalist, 30 years on
item.description: Jack Picone reflects on his journey through Rwanda in 1994, and the lifelong nightmares it has left him with.

item.title: Poland holds local elections in test for PM Tusk’s coalition government
item.description: About 190,000 registered candidates running for local government positions, including mayors and councillors.

item.title: A week of mourning in Rwanda to commemorate 30 years of 1994 genocide
item.description: President Paul Kagame leads rites in Kigali as the African nation marks one of the bloodiest massacres of 20th century.

item.title: Reusing scalpels, operating with no anaesthesia: A doctor’s diary in Gaza
item.description: Riyadh Almasharqah spent two weeks in Gaza's European Hospital, is trying to return to continue caring for people there.

item.title: Rwanda, 30 years after genocide
item.description: 30 years after the genocide against the Tutsis, we explain how it started, how it ended and how it impacts Rwanda today.

item.title: Six months on from Afghanistan’s devastating earthquakes
item.description: On October 7, a series of powerful earthquakes hit remote western Afghanistan with much of the devastation hidden.

item.title: Israel’s war on Gaza – six relentless months of death and destruction
item.description: A look at the devastating toll Israel's war on Gaza has taken on the Palestinian people.
